snippet: A report by Amnesty International said that many of the 1.2 million Afghans who have been forced from their homes were living in miserable conditions in camps.
lead_paragraph: KABUL  Afghanistan — The number of Afghans internally displaced by the 15-year conflict in their country has more than doubled since the beginning of 2013  with an average of 1 000 people a day forced from their homes this year alone  Amnesty International said on Tuesday.
abstract: A report by Amnesty International said that many of the 1.2 million Afghans who have been forced from their homes were living in miserable conditions in camps.
headline__main: Number of Displaced Afghans Has More Than Doubled Since 2013
headline__print_headline: 1 000 Afghans Each Day Are Fleeing Their Homes

snippet: The World Health Organization is the latest United Nations agency seeking to add a new sense of urgency to the humanitarian crisis in Syria.
lead_paragraph: GENEVA — Outbreaks of hepatitis A and other diseases spread by poor hygiene are now becoming problems among Syrians displaced by the civil war  the World Health Organization said Tuesday. It is one of at least four United Nations agencies seeking to add a new sense of urgency to the humanitarian crisis afflicting the country.
abstract: The World Health Organization is the latest United Nations agency seeking to add a new sense of urgency to the humanitarian crisis in Syria.
headline__main: New Problems in Syria: Hepatitis  Closed Hospitals  Ambulance Shortages

snippet: At Washington's initiative  delegates from Iraqi opposition groups worked out a plan in London in December for governing Iraq should Saddam Hussein's regime collapse. Their declared aims are democratic  but one sure way to find out is to ask how t...
lead_paragraph: At Washington's initiative  delegates from Iraqi opposition groups worked out a plan in London in December for governing Iraq should Saddam Hussein's regime collapse. Their declared aims are democratic  but one sure way to find out is to ask how they will deal with more than a million people who have already been forcibly displaced inside the country.
abstract: At Washington's initiative  delegates from Iraqi opposition groups worked out a plan in London in December for governing Iraq should Saddam Hussein's regime collapse. Their declared aims are democratic  but one sure way to find out is to ask how they will
headline__main: Kurds  Shiites and others : Iraq's displaced:a test for democracy
headline__print_headline: Kurds  Shiites and others : Iraq's displaced:a test for democracy

snippet: Iraqi government has displaced or relocated nearly million Iraqis in last three decades  majority of them Kurds; report by Brookings Institution says this has created deep regional and ethnic fractures that could erupt into civil war if Pres Sadda...
lead_paragraph: The Iraqi government has displaced or relocated nearly a million Iraqis in the last three decades  creating deep regional and ethnic fractures that could erupt into civil war if President Saddam Hussein is deposed  according to a new report.
abstract: Iraqi government has displaced or relocated nearly million Iraqis in last three decades  majority of them Kurds; report by Brookings Institution says this has created deep regional and ethnic fractures that could erupt into civil war if Pres Saddam Hussein is deposed; says Kurds whose villages were razed or mined by Iraqi military are living in ramshackle communities  and any effort by them to regain control of fertile  oil-rich northern city of Kirkuk could set off conflict; report underscores rising tide of concern among Iraq's neighbors  international aid groups and foreign policy experts about chaos that could be unleashed if US forcefully deposes Hussein (M)
headline__main: Iraqi City Seen as Powder Keg If Hussein Were to Be Ousted
headline__print_headline: THREATS AND RESPONSES: DISPLACED IRAQIS; Iraqi City Seen as Powder Keg If Hussein Were to Be Ousted

snippet: Letter from Erin Mooney and Balkees Jarrah  officials of Brookings Institution-University of Bern Project on Internal Displacement  says it is critical to ensure that Iraqis displaced within country are able to vote; says disenfranchisement will p...
abstract: Letter from Erin Mooney and Balkees Jarrah  officials of Brookings Institution-University of Bern Project on Internal Displacement  says it is critical to ensure that Iraqis displaced within country are able to vote; says disenfranchisement will pose challenges to their return and raise questions about legitimacy of process (Jan 18 article)
